content.question: A <math alttext="2.00 mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of <math alttext="C 2 H 5 O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> undergoes the phase transition illustrated in the diagram above. The molar enthalpy of vaporization, <math alttext="delta H sub vaporization" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>vap</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, of <math alttext="C 2 H 5 O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="positive 38.6 kilojoules per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>38.6</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following best identifies the change in enthalpy in the phase transition shown in the diagram?

skill.text: 1.B: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate both particulate-level and macroscopic- level properties.
